description.narrative: -This transaction would represent IFC''s first education transaction in Morocco. Demonstration Effect: Supporting a private educational institute that achieves E4E objectives including the provision of quality education geared towards market needs. Scalability: Facilitating regional expansion of a quality private services provider with a scalable model to increase student reach by more than 1.5 times over the next 10 years. Increase Access: to relevant higher education to lower income students and youth in remote cities through comparatively more affordable tuition, thereby increasing number of youth holding relevant skills needed by the market, including soft skills, improving their employment prospects.

HEM Group (HEM) or Institut des Hautes Etudes de Management is a private Moroccan business school that currently operates 5 campuses in Rabat, Casablanca, Marrakesh, Tangiers, and Fes and serving 2,200 students. Founded in 1988, HEM has built a model based on strong pedagogical methods, yet relevant to Morocco''s social and economic realities. With a strategic eye on future growth, the Group is undertaking a US$20 million investment program to support the Groups expansion plans in Morocco which includes the constructing and replacing its existing campus in Rabat, the geographical expansion of HEM business schools into 2 new cities and the establishment of a new private technical university in Casablanca. The Project is being proposed within the context of IFCs E4E Initiative for Arab Youth (E4E), which supports private sector provision of quality, job-oriented higher education in a country with rapidly growing population making employment imperative and most urgent.
